entry.title: Entendendo o Tipo de Item (Item Category) na Ordem de Venda – SAP SD
entry.content:
O que é um Tipo de Item (Item Category)?

O tipo de item determina o comportamento de cada linha da ordem de venda, incluindo:

 

  • Relevância para entrega e faturamento
  • Relevância para estoque (movimentação de mercadoria)
  • Relevância para preço
  • Permissão para entrada de quantidade zero ou valor zero
  • Se o item é apenas informativo ou comercial
  • Geração de requisição de transporte ou não

 

Ele é configurado no SPRO:

SAP IMG → Sales and Distribution → Sales → Sales Documents → Sales Document Item → Define Item Categories

Como o sistema determina o tipo de item?

O SAP usa a chave de determinação de tipo de item, baseada em três elementos:

  • Tipo de documento de venda (ex: OR)
  • Categoria de item do material (Item Category Group no material master)
  • Uso (Usage, opcional)
  • Alta/Baixa de estoque (Higher-level item category, se houver hierarquia)

 

Essa combinação é configurada via transação VOV4, e permite a determinação automática do tipo de item ao inserir o material na ordem.

 

Campos críticos na configuração (transação VOV7)

  • Billing relevance – determina se o item será faturado
  • Item relevant for delivery – indica se gera entrega
  • Pricing – se há cálculo de preço
  • Schedule line allowed – se o item permite cronogramas
  • Completion rule – como o item deve ser encerrado
  • Business data not copied – se dados da linha são independentes da linha pai

 

Impacto funcional do tipo de item

O tipo de item é decisivo para diversos processos integrados, como:

  • Pricing: Define se condições de preço são aplicáveis
  • Logística: Determina se gera entrega ou não
  • Contábil: Impacta no faturamento e contabilização
  • MRP: Pode disparar ou não planejamento de necessidades

O domínio da lógica de tipo de item é essencial para consultores funcionais SAP SD. Ele é a ponte entre o que o negócio quer vender e o que o sistema efetivamente executa.

Na dúvida? Analise o comportamento do item na VOV7 e a chave de determinação na VOV4, isso resolve 90% dos erros funcionais em ordens de venda.

E se você achou o conteúdo importante, deixe um comentário!

entry.title: Best approach to trigger automatic email notifications for COFC error messages in SAP
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We are currently facing recurring COFC error messages in SAP, such as:

"A master record for 11030211/MACH01 exists only in 2021"

This occurs because the system fails to find valid pricing data for old work centers (e.g., SG20). If these COFC errors are not resolved within the current period, they can affect the accuracy of actual activity costs, delay settlements, and cause production variances.

To prevent recurrence, we are considering setting up automated email notifications when such COFC errors are detected. The requirements are:

  1. Automatically send an email to a designated PIC when a COFC error is triggered.

  2. Email title format:
    "COFC error for company code SG10 Plant SG17 as at <posting date>"

Question:
What is the best approach to implement this auto-email setup in SAP?

  • Is it advisable to use a user-exit, implicit enhancement, or custom background job for detecting COFC errors?

  • Which table(s) or log(s) should be monitored to reliably capture COFC-related messages in real-time or batch?

  • Any recommendations for sending formatted email alerts via ABAP?

Appreciate any advice or examples you can share.

Thank you!

entry.title: Customizing GL/AP/AR Overview Reports for Fiscal Year Variant and Profit Center
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

Has anyone successfully customized the General Ledger, Accounts Payable, or Accounts Receivable Overview Reports to include Fiscal Year (13 periods) and Profit Center?

We have a requirement to reflect Profit Center-level reporting, as multiple business units operate under a single company code but act as distinct entities. Additionally, we use a 13-period fiscal year, which we want reflected in the report layout.

We initially tried adding filters to the parameters, assuming it would fulfill the requirement. However, further analysis revealed that these reports are designed for company code-level reporting and retrieve data from BSEG, which limits Profit Center visibility. Adjusting the logic seems necessary.

Given this, has anyone found a workaround or implemented enhancements to:

  • Include Profit Center reporting in these overview apps?

  • Support 13-period fiscal calendars in reporting layouts?

Any advice, examples, or technical guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: DBTABLOG table performance issue
entry.content:
The issue you mentioned in this case about DBTABLOG table, that is kind of complicated.

There is no one trick to kill this issue immediately, there are multi task you need to perform for the finial perpose - better performance on DBTABLOG table .

Here I am summarizing these task for you, you could refer to these note and perform them gradually in the coming period.

1. adjustment for avoiding known issue
3295259 - Unexpected slow performance for DELETE statements against table WDR_ADP_CONST_MP
3325618 - RV80HGEN | Performance issue due massive updates in table DBTABLOG for table TFRM
1834803 - Disable logging of changes on customizing tables

2. reduce table size
2335014 - DBTABLOG | Reduce size
2362854 - Incomplete cleanup of archived long text logs
2388295 - RSTBPDEL | Delete logs periodically

3. add partition
2044468 - FAQ: SAP HANA Partitioning
=>
DBTABLOG HASH LOGID

4. others for your refference
2335086 - DBTABLOG | How to detect tables with the highest number of logs
2161258 - RSTBPDEL performance issue with selection of one or some tables

entry.title: small batch trial production
entry.content:
Dear experts
I have a few questions as follows:
1. During small batch trial production, only semi-finished products are produced, and no finished products are generated. Since the semi-finished products have a procurement type of E50, it is not possible to generate demand and work orders. To generate demand and work orders, the procurement type needs to be changed to E (empty).

2. After formal production begins, the semi-finished products serve as components under the finished products and need to be changed back to virtual items.

3. Some materials were originally purchased with procurement type F, but later changed to in-house production, type E, for small batch trial production. However, this also causes the semi-finished products of other new orders to become in-house production during the small batch trial process.

Are there any good solutions to these problems? thanks.

entry.title: Re: Customizing GL/AP/AR Overview Reports for Fiscal Year...
entry.content:
Hello @Rap1 ,

-Use custom CDS view - fiori app.
-Go for for views that contain both financial transaction data and Profit Center information-for eg - I_GLACCOUNTLINEITEMCUBE.
-Go to "Elements" and select ProfitCenter, FiscalYear, FiscalPeriod, and the relevant key figures (amounts).
-Publish your custom CDS view.
-Now, go to custom analytical query app and select the CDS view.In "Display," drag ProfitCenter to Rows or Columns, and FiscalYear and FiscalPeriod to Columns or drill-down dimensions.
-Add any necessary filters on the "Filters" tab.
-Preview the report to ensure it meets your requirements.
-Publish your analytical query.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Leverage High Availability feature of Cloud Connector from ABAP backend System for Service Chann
entry.content:
Hi Community,

"The Cloud Connector have in built product High Available feature, with two node setup, one acting as Master and other as Shadow. For the On-Premise ABAP/Private Cloud ABAP system to be able to call the ABAP Cloud tenant services, a type-3 ABAP connection RFC has to be defined in the backend ABAP system with the destination of Cloud Connector host. In High Available cloud connector setup, the RFC in backend ABAP system fails if it does not have the current master host of the Cloud Connector as defined target host. To bridge this gap, a TCP-Network Load Balancer (Layer 4) is needed between the ABAP system and the Cloud Connector, to redirect the connection to the current master instance of the Cloud Connector."

 

Thanks for your selfless sharing, it really help us a lot.

🙂

 

Regards,

ZFiori.

entry.title: SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model - RFA's field customization feature
entry.content:
As you already know we have Remote Function Adapter (RFA) finance functions in our SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM) which allows posting of documents to S/4 HANA On Premise using Cloud Connector.  

These RFA finance function types like Finance General Ledger have been offered with its default static field list that can only be adjusted upon feature request - to request for new feature, visit https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/  

As much as the default list is mostly effective to majority of customers, there are still some customers having specific fields and posting needs. 

Due to this, SAP PAPM Cloud SM is now offering a flexible way for your administrators to add the desired finance fields.  

Yes, you've read it right! you can now add your customer's requested fields to have better posting experience. Let me show you how.

First, you need to identify the components that you need.

  1. In your S/4 HANA On Premise, Run SE37 
  2. Display the function module: BAPI_ACC_DOCUMENT_POST 
  3. Choose Tables tab 
  4. Then double click on Associated Type (e.g. BAPIACGL09) 

Now, in order to add these components to your RFA Function follow these steps. 

  1. Go to your SAP PaPM Cloud SM tenant 
  2. Choose Menu > Administration > Settings 
  3. Scroll down to Modeling Settings section 
  4. Then choose the Customize RFA Template button 

From here, you can add the components by choosing the Add Mapping Fields button and then maintain the required fields inside the Add Mapping Field to Your RFA Template popup dialog. For details about the required fields, visit  Modeling Settings on Help Portal.

NOTE: This option is currently available only for  “Finance General Ledger” and “Finance General Ledger Items” RFA types.

Few important reminders:

  1. Once the fields are added in the RFA Settings screen, modelers will need to add a new RFA function in the modeling for the new fields to be visible in the Mapping node.
  2. If you then decide to remove or delete a field that you have added, take note that this field won't be considered for any RFA functions that are using it.
  3. If in any case you are importing an environment coming from SAP PaPM On-Prem version, take note that you need to manually add any components that are new for your SAP PaPM Cloud SM system.

I hope the information provided in this blog post is able to help you start using this new screen and explore it by adding new components for your RFA postings. Until the next new features!

entry.title: Cleanup of /SDF/CC_REL
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

 

This is a generic question as I'm unable to find any notes related to it. 

 

Is there a standard program or functionality which can be used to perform mass deletion on /SDF/CC_REL table? This table has come up as one of the top tables in our DEV system and we are looking for options to reduce its footprint in the database. 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Cleanup of /SDF/CC_REL
entry.content:
Dear ,

 

There is currently no way to reduce the volume of this table. 

CCREF data should only be collected on quality systems, where the coding is stable. It should not be activated on a development system (too much useless data, coding is unstable/evolving) or on a productive system (too much performance impact). 

To delete CCREF data, you can use manual or automatic deletion: 

  • Manual Deletion
  1. Deactivate the References extractor and analysis jobs via SOLMAN_SETUP. 
  2. Delete the content of the tables /SDF/CC_OBJECT and /SDF/CC_REF directly on the managed system
  3. In the Solution Manager system, execute TCode RSA1
  4. Perform a selective deletion from the infocube 0SM_CCREF for the corresponding system ID.
  • Automatic Deletion
  1. In the Solution Manager system, execute the report RAGS_RESET_CCREF. This report will perform remotely (by RFC) the deletion of the CCREF data on the managed system and the deactivation of the CCREF analysis job, and it will also delete the data for this system from the 0SM_CCREF infocube. You simply need to specify the system ID and tick the checkbox for the job un-scheduling. (Note: Be aware that this report can run for a very long time, so you might want to execute it in background mode).

 

Best regards,

Leo

SAP Support

entry.title: Intercompany Stock Transfer (1P9) in S/4HANA Cloud ERP, Public Edition
entry.content:
This blog post takes an in-depth look at the classic SAP intercompany stock transfer (as opposed to the Advanced Inter-Company Transfer). We try to offer a comprehensive setup guide, testing procedures, and more details during implementation and adoption. If you’re interested in this business process—or have questions—feel free to leave a comment and discuss!

The features covered in this article are based on SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition 2508, please refer to the latest information for changes in subsequent versions.

 

Index

Intercompany Stock Transfer process overview

Business Process Configuration

Business Partner Master Data Configuration

Product Master Data Configuration

Issues worth discussion

 

Intercompany Stock Transfer process overview

A cross-company code stock transfer process is executed using a normal purchase order with document type NB and item category Empty in the receiving plant. A vendor master record must be created for the supplying plant, specifying its relationship with the plant.

While an intra-company stock transfer order use document type UB with item category U. Just enter the plant in supplier field, no need to create vendor master record for the supplying plant.

Create Intercompany Stock Transfer Order

APP: Create Purchase Order - Advanced (ME21N)

A stock transport order is created for the receiving plant 1320 (Belong to company code 1320) in the item level.  Business Partner PL1311BP in the header represents supplying Plant 1311 (Belong to Company code 1310). The system then recognizes that you are creating a stock transport order when the supplier entered matches a plant in another company code. Then, in the background, the shipping information is determined based on master data and configuration settings.

After clicking Save, purchase order 4500000627 created.

Create Replenishment Delivery for Stock Transfer Order

App My Purchase Orders - Due for Delivery (VL10B)

The replenishment delivery is created for the appropriate shipping point using the My Purchase Orders Due for Deliveryapp, where the stock transport order number can act as a selection criteria.

Open the app, enter a shipping point, and a due date (optional). The system selects stock transport orders due for delivery. The ship-to party is determined from the configuration: the receiving plant is assigned a business partner master record that represents the ship-to party.

You can flag the orders that you want to work on and choose Background. The system then creates replenishment deliveries for these orders in the background.

A green light on indicating outbound delivery successfully created. Double click on the Originating Doc 4500000627 to show the outbound delivery ID 80000283 under Purchase Order History tab.

The delivery type to be used for the replenishment delivery is also determined automatically based on configuration settings: it is defined for the combination of order document type NB and the issuing plant used. The default delivery type for an outbound delivery for a cross company-code stock transport order is delivery type NLCC (Replen.Cross­Company).

App: Change Outbound Delivery (VL02N)

In the header, administration tab

Before Picking and Posting goods issue, let us check the stock

APP: Stock - Single Material

APP: Overdue Materials - Stock in Transit (F2139)

APP: Stock Overview (MMBE)

Pick and Post Goods Issue for Stock Transfer Order

Fiori App Manage Outbound Deliveries (F0867A)

Apart from VL02N, we can also use this APP to search for delivery document with status Ready for Picking.

Click Pick, new window pop up, enter the picked quantity and clic Save. You will have the following screen where you can proeed to Post GI.

After Post GI, the statue change from Not yet processed to Completely Processed.

Check Status of Stock Transfer

Issuing plant 1311 stock quantity decrease by 2. From 108 to 106.

After PGI, Delivery document will appear

Scheduled for delivery stock and unrestricted stock decrease by 2 in issue plant 1311. From 135 to 133, 4 to 2 respectively

After goods issue in the issuing company code, the goods have not yet been posted in the receiving plant. In accounting terms, the goods do not yet belong to the company code of the receiving plant. Both unrestricted-use stock and on-order stock remain unchanged for the receiving plant.  The quantity that is currently being shipped is visible in the system in a special stock type for cross-company code stock in transit. The cumulative value of all cross-company code stock in transit can be displayed for a plant or a complete company code.

APP: Display Stock in Transit (MB5T)

Material document with movement type 643

Accounting document

Post Goods Receipt for Stock Transfer Order

APP: Post Goods Receipt to Purchasing Document (F0843)

Post goods receipt on the purchase order and enter receipt quantity click Post.

Material document with movement type 101 created.

From a financial point of view, the materials are now posted to the stock value of the company code to which the receiving plant is assigned. During the goods receipt posting, an accounting document is created and the purchase order price is used to valuate the goods receipt (that is, if the goods receipt is posted before the incoming invoice receipt is posted)

The unrestricted-use stock in the receiving plant increases as soon as the goods receipt is posted. The on-order stock and the cross-company code stock in transit are reduced by the quantity received.

Create Intercompany Billing Document

APP: Create Billing Documents - VF04

Check Intercompany-Related

Billing document 90000391 has been created upon Save.  Please be noted the billing price was taken from PIC1 in purchase order item.

Pricing procedure Intercomp Stock Transfer is adapted here

In case you have maintained purchasing info record for PPR0, the result shows it will be inactive due to PIC1 available already

Document flow of delivery document will help find the accounting document for Billing

Create Supplier Invoice

The internal invoice that was sent by the supplying company code, needs to be posted as an incoming invoice in the receiving company code. Invoice receipt is also visible in the purchase order history of the cross-company code stock transport order. You can use the Create Supplier Invoice or the Create Supplier Invoice - Advanced app to enter manually and post a supplier invoice related to a cross-company code stock transport order.

Accounting document:

Business Process Configuration

Define Shipping Data for Delivering Plant

SSCUI 101926 Define Shipping Data for Plants

The purpose of this activity is to define shipping data for supplying plant (to allocate sales organization, distribution channel, division and customer no.to the plant for which intercompany stock transfer processing is possible). Meanwhile make sure product description include the same language version as the one maintained here.

Define Internal Customer Number By Sales Organization

SSCUI 105970 Maintain sales organizations.

Enter the following data in Customer Number for Intercompany Billing field.

Maintain Intercompany Condition Record

APP: Set Material Prices Sales on condition type PI01

Assign Picking Location

SSCUI 102130 Assign Picking Locations

Assign Shipping Points

SSCUI 102126 Assign Shipping Points

Business Partner Master Data Configuration

Create Business Partner General Data

APP: Manage Business Partner Master Data F3163

Create Business Partner ID for Ordering plant 1320

Create Business Partner ID for Supplying plant 1311

Create/Extend Customer BP by assigning Company Code and Sales Area Data

Extend Customer (Fin.Accounting) role for Ordering plant 1320 and assign company code 1310 representing this plant is the customer of company code 1310

APP: Maintain Business Partner

Extend Customer role for Ordering plant 1320 and assign sales area

Remember to maintain the tax classification for customer so that the TTX1 can be derived properly in sales order pricing

Also remember to assign shipping condition so that SSCUI 102126 Assign shipping points for each plant will derive the right shipping point

Create/Extend Supplier BP by assigning Company Code and Purchasing Organization Data

Extend Supplier (Fin.Accounting) role for Supplying plant 1311 and assign company code 1320 representing it is the supplier of company code 1320

Extend Supplier role for Supplying plant 1311 representing and assign purchase organization

Create/Extend Business Partners Representing the Plants Codes

This link the supplying plant 1311 as the supplier

Product Master Data Configuration

Maintain Distribution Channels and receiving and issuing plants

APP: Manage product master data

Assign Loading Group

Issues worth discussion

Issue 1:

Even though goods receipted has been done on receiving plant, you can still cancel the post goods issue on issuing plant (MvT 101 material document cancellation) without any check in standard logic. So one direction is to add check logic in BADI.

More:

My intercompany blogs:

Intercompany integration scenarios FAQ in Cloud ER... - SAP Community

Advanced Intercompany Sales MTO and Variant Configuration (7DM) in S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition

高级公司间库存转储 (5HP) SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition

公司间库存转储 (1P9) SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

My In-depth session on comparing Classic and Advance intercompany scenarios 1P9 vs 5HP and 1HO vs 5D2 with finance effect ( In Chinese). Only registered customer and partner can view.

GCR - S/4HANA Customer Advisory Council(CAC) - Content/Resources/大中华区线上分享/In-depth with S4HANA Cloud...

Hope you LIKE it if it addresses your issue. After that, please feel free to comment after following my account and I will reply ASAP.

entry.title: Re: Generate EAM log for Firefighter sessions with no act...
entry.content:
Dear Priya777,

SPRO parameter 4020 is not just for transaction, it is for any log. Essentially if you have at least one line of record in any log source, then the Session will be sent to the contoller. Please check whether Changelog or Audit log is not collected. Depends on what you are logging in these source, even the logon can generate logs.

Please be advised that GRC just collect the logs and not proceesing it, hence - beside some very limited basic filtering - all the logs what is generated will be collected, no matter you executed any transaction or not.

If there is zero lineitem, and beside the 4020 the Session is sent to controller, please open a Support Case to SAP can check it.

Kind regards, 
Mate

I’m working on a tabstrip screen that contains two tabs: Expense Logic and Attendance Logic. I’ve noticed an issue where, after clicking the second tab and executing the logic, the screen automatically reverts back to the first tab (Expense Logic) when I navigate back.

What I need is:

The selected tab should remain active after execution — it should not switch back automatically.

Could you please help me resolve this issue?

            WRITE: / 'Name        :', wa_table-emname,
                     'Month       :', wa_table-month_no,
                     'Year        :', wa_table-year_no,
                     'Amount      :', wa_table-amount.


          ELSEIF  p_dept IS NOT INITIAL AND p_month IS INITIAL AND p_year IS INITIAL
                 AND wa_table-departmnt = p_dept.

            lv_total_expense = lv_total_expense + wa_table-amount.


            WRITE: / 'Name        :', wa_table-emname,
                     'Month       :', wa_table-month_no,
                     'Year        :', wa_table-year_no,

          ELSEIF p_amt IS NOT INITIAL AND s_date IS NOT INITIAL

            lv_total_expense = lv_total_expense + wa_table-amount.

            WRITE: / 'Date   :', wa_table-expense_date,
                     'Amount :', wa_table-amount.


          ELSEIF p_year IS NOT INITIAL AND p_month IS INITIAL AND p_dept IS INITIAL
                AND s_date IS INITIAL AND p_amt IS INITIAL
                AND wa_table-year_no = p_year.

            lv_total_expense = lv_total_expense + wa_table-amount.

            WRITE: / 'Grand Total Expense:', lv_total_expense,
                   'Month       :', wa_table-month_no,
                   'Year        :', wa_table-year_no.


          ENDIF.


        ENDLOOP.

      ELSEIF r_dept = 'X'.


        IF p_month IS INITIAL AND p_year IS INITIAL.

          SELECT emid,
                 month_no,
                 year_no,
                 SUM( amount ) AS total_exp
            INTO TABLE @DATA(it_total_expense)
            FROM zexpense
            GROUP BY emid, month_no, year_no.

        ELSE.

          SELECT emid,
                 month_no,
                 year_no,
                 SUM( amount ) AS total_exp
            FROM zexpense
            WHERE ( month_no IS NOT INITIAL AND month_no = @p_month )
              AND ( year_no  IS NOT INITIAL AND year_no  = @p_year  )
            GROUP BY emid, month_no, year_no
             INTO TABLE @IT_total_expense.

        ENDIF.

        LOOP AT it_total_expense INTO DATA(wa_total_expense).

          " Check if entry exists in ZMONTHSALARIES


          SELECT SINGLE emid
            FROM zmonthsalaries
            WHERE emid     = @wa_total_expense-emid
              AND month_no = @wa_total_expense-month_no
              AND year_no  = @wa_total_expense-year_no
            INTO @DATA(lv_exist_emid).

          IF sy-subrc = 0.
            zmonthsalaries-emid              = wa_total_expense-emid.
            zmonthsalaries-month_no          = wa_total_expense-month_no.
            zmonthsalaries-year_no           = wa_total_expense-year_no.
            zmonthsalaries-totalexpenses     = wa_total_expense-total_exp.
            zmonthsalaries-last_updated_date = sy-datum.
            zmonthsalaries-last_updated_time = sy-uzeit.

            MODIFY zmonthsalaries FROM zmonthsalaries.
            WRITE: / 'Updated:', wa_total_expense-emid, 'Total Expense:', wa_total_expense-total_exp.

          ELSE.
            "                Insert
            zmonthsalaries-emid              = wa_total_expense-emid.
            zmonthsalaries-month_no          = wa_total_expense-month_no.
            zmonthsalaries-year_no           = wa_total_expense-year_no.
            zmonthsalaries-totalexpenses     = wa_total_expense-total_exp.
            zmonthsalaries-last_updated_date = sy-datum.
            zmonthsalaries-last_updated_time = sy-uzeit.

            INSERT zmonthsalaries FROM zmonthsalaries.
            WRITE: / 'Inserted:', wa_total_expense-emid, 'Total Expense:', wa_total_expense-total_exp.

          ENDIF.

        ENDLOOP.


        ELSEIF  R_TYPE = 'X'.

          CLEAR: ITK_TABLE, WAK_TABLE.

          SELECT A~EMID,
                 A~EMNAME,
                 A~DEPARTMNT,
                 B~MONTH_NO,
                 B~MNTH_NME,
                 B~YEAR_NO,
                 SUM( B~AMOUNT ) AS TOTALEXPENSES
            INTO TABLE @ITK_TABLE
            FROM ZEMPLOYS AS A
            INNER JOIN ZEXPENSE AS B ON A~EMID = B~EMID
            GROUP BY A~EMID, A~EMNAME, A~DEPARTMNT, B~MONTH_NO, B~MNTH_NME, B~YEAR_NO.


            LOOP AT ITK_TABLE INTO WAK_TABLE.


              WRITE: / 'Employee:', WAK_TABLE-EMID, WAK_TABLE-EMNAME,
                       'Dept:', WAK_TABLE-DEPARTMNT,
                       'Month:', WAK_TABLE-MNTH_NME,
                       'Year:', WAK_TABLE-YEAR_NO,
                       'Total Expense:', WAK_TABLE-TOTALEXPENSES.

            ENDLOOP.

          ENDIF.


    WHEN 'TAB22'.

      IF  p_att1 = 'X'.


        IF p_months IS INITIAL AND p_yrs IS INITIAL.



          SELECT emid,
                 month_no,
                 year_no,
            COUNT(*) AS present_days
            INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE @IT_attendance
            FROM zattendancedet
            GROUP BY emid, month_no, year_no.


        ELSEIF p_months IS NOT INITIAL AND p_yrs IS NOT INITIAL .


          SELECT emid,
                 month_no,
                 year_no,
                 COUNT(*) AS present_days
               INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE @IT_attendance
               FROM zattendancedet
               WHERE month_no = @p_months
               AND year_no = @P_yrs
               AND atendnce_stus = 'P'
               GROUP BY emid, month_no, year_no.
        ENDIF.

        LOOP AT it_attendance INTO wa_ATTENDANCE.

          WRITE: / 'Employee ID:',wa_ATTENDANCE-emid,
                   'Year:', wa_ATTENDANCE-year_no,
                   'Month:',wa_ATTENDANCE-month_no,
                   'Total Present Days:',wa_ATTENDANCE-present_days.

        ENDLOOP.




      ELSEIF  p_att2 = 'X'.


        IF p_months IS INITIAL AND p_yrs IS INITIAL AND S_dte IS INITIAL AND p_depts IS INITIAL.

          SELECT zemploys~emid,
                     zemploys~departmnt,
                     zattendancedet~month_no,
                     zattendancedet~year_no,
        zattendancedet~date_no,
                     zemploys~emname,


                 SUM( CASE WHEN zattendancedet~atendnce_stus = 'P' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END ) AS present_days,
                 SUM( CASE WHEN zattendancedet~atendnce_stus = 'A' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END ) AS absent_days,
                   SUM( CASE WHEN zattendancedet~atendnce_stus = 'L' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END ) AS leave_days
                INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE @IT_attendance
                FROM Zemploys
               INNER JOIN zattendancedet
            ON zemploys~emid = zattendancedet~emid
                GROUP BY zemploys~emid,
                         zemploys~departmnt,
                         zattendancedet~month_no,
                           Zemploys~emname,
                         zattendancedet~year_no,
                         zattendancedet~date_NO.


        ELSEIF  p_months IS NOT INITIAL AND p_yrs IS NOT INITIAL AND S_dte IS  NOT INITIAL AND p_depts IS NOT INITIAL .


          SELECT zemploys~emid,
                     zemploys~departmnt,
                     zattendancedet~month_no,
                     zattendancedet~year_no,
                   zattendancedet~date_no,
                     zemploys~emname  ,

                 SUM( CASE WHEN zattendancedet~atendnce_stus = 'P' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END ) AS present_days,
                 SUM( CASE WHEN zattendancedet~atendnce_stus = 'A' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END ) AS absent_days,
                   SUM( CASE WHEN zattendancedet~atendnce_stus = 'L' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END ) AS leave_days
                INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE @IT_attendance
                FROM Zemploys
                INNER JOIN zattendancedet
            ON zemploys~emid = zattendancedet~emid
            WHERE zemploys~departmnt = @p_depts
              AND zattendancedet~month_no = @p_months
              AND zattendancedet~year_no = @p_yrs
              AND zattendancedet~Date_no IN @S_dte
                GROUP BY zemploys~emid,
                         zemploys~departmnt,
                         zattendancedet~month_no,
                           Zemploys~emname,
                         zattendancedet~year_no,
                   zattendancedet~date_NO.

        ENDIF.
        LOOP AT it_attendance INTO wa_attendance.
          WRITE: / 'Department:', wa_attendance-departmnt,
                   'Employee ID:', wa_attendance-emid,
                   'Employee Name:', wa_attendance-emname,
                   'Year:', wa_attendance-year_no,
                   'Month:', wa_attendance-month_no,
               'Date:', wa_attendance-date_no,

     'Total Present Days:',wa_attendance-present_days,
                   'Total Absent Days:', wa_attendance-absent_days,
                 'Total Leave Days:', wa_attendance-leave_days.

        ENDLOOP.



      ELSEIF p_att3 = 'X'.

        IF p_months IS INITIAL AND p_yrs IS INITIAL AND p_emid IS INITIAL.

          SELECT emid,
                 month_no,
                 year_no,
                 COUNT(*) AS present_days
            INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE @LT_present_data
            FROM zattendancedet
            GROUP BY emid, month_no, year_no.


        ELSEIF  p_months IS NOT INITIAL AND p_yrs IS NOT INITIAL AND p_emid IS  NOT INITIAL .

          SELECT emid,
                 month_no,
                 year_no,
                 COUNT(*) AS present_days
            INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE @LT_present_data
            FROM zattendancedet
            WHERE atendnce_stus = 'P'
              AND month_no = @p_months
              AND year_no  = @p_yrs
            AND emid     = @p_emid
            GROUP BY emid, month_no, year_no.
        ENDIF.
        LOOP AT lt_present_data INTO ls_present_data.

          CLEAR wa_attendance_summary.
          wa_attendance_summary-emid         = ls_present_data-emid.
          wa_attendance_summary-month_no     = ls_present_data-month_no.
          wa_attendance_summary-year_no      = ls_present_data-year_no.
          wa_attendance_summary-present_days = ls_present_data-present_days.

          SELECT COUNT(*) INTO @wa_attendance_summary-workingdays
            FROM zattendancedet
            WHERE emid     = @LS_present_data-emid
              AND month_no = @LS_present_data-month_no
              AND year_no  = @LS_present_data-year_no.

          IF wa_attendance_summary-workingdays > 0.
            wa_attendance_summary-attendnpercent =
              ( ls_present_data-present_days * 100 ) / wa_attendance_summary-workingdays.
          ELSE.
            wa_attendance_summary-attendnpercent = 0.
          ENDIF.

          APPEND wa_attendance_summary TO it_attendance_summary.

        ENDLOOP.

        WRITE: / 'EMID', 'MONTH', 'YEAR','WORKINGDAYS','PRESENTDAYS', 'ATTENDANCE %'.


        LOOP AT it_attendance_summary INTO wa_attendance_summary.
          WRITE: / wa_attendance_summary-emid,
                   wa_attendance_summary-month_no,
                   wa_attendance_summary-year_no,
                   wa_attendance_summary-workingdays,
                   wa_attendance_summary-present_days,
                   wa_attendance_summary-attendnpercent.
        ENDLOOP.

*      endif.



      ELSEIF p_att4 = 'X'.

  IF p_months IS INITIAL AND p_yrs IS INITIAL AND p_emid IS INITIAL.

    SELECT emid,
             date_no,
             day_no,
             atendnce_stus,
             leave_typ,
             year_no,
             month_no
        INTO TABLE @LT_att
        FROM zattendancedet.

  elseif p_months IS not INITIAL AND p_yrs IS not INITIAL AND p_emid IS not INITIAL.


             SELECT emid,
             date_no,
             day_no,
             atendnce_stus,
             leave_typ,
             year_no,
             month_no
        INTO TABLE @LT_att
        FROM zattendancedet
        WHERE year_no  = @p_yrs
     AND emid     = @p_emid
     AND month_no = @p_months.


ENDif.



        WRITE:/ sy-uline(60).

        WRITE: / 'Employee Attendance Details - Month:', p_months, 'Year:', p_yrs, 60 sy-vline.

        WRITE:/ sy-uline(60).


        WRITE:/ sy-uline(130).

        WRITE:/ 'EmpID' COLOR 2,20 sy-vline,'Date' COLOR 2,40 sy-vline,'Day' COLOR 2,60 sy-vline,'atendnce stus' COLOR 2, 80 sy-vline, 'Leave Type' COLOR 2, 100 sy-vline, 'year' COLOR 2, 120 sy-vline,'Month',130 sy-vline.

        WRITE:/ sy-uline(130).


        "Loop and Display Records
        LOOP AT lt_att INTO wa_att.

          WRITE:/ wa_att-emid COLOR 2,20 sy-vline, wa_att-date_no DD/MM/YYYY COLOR 2,40 sy-vline,wa_att-day_no COLOR 2,60 sy-vline, wa_att-atendnce_stus COLOR 2, 80 sy-vline,  wa_att-leave_typ COLOR 2, 100 sy-vline,wa_att-month_no COLOR 2, 120 sy-vline,
          wa_att-year_no, 130 sy-vline.


          " Count attendance categories
          CASE wa_att-atendnce_stus.
            WHEN 'P'.
              lv_present = lv_present + 1.
            WHEN 'A'.
              lv_absent  = lv_absent + 1.
            WHEN 'L'.
              lv_leave   = lv_leave + 1.
          ENDCASE.

        ENDLOOP.

        "Summary Section
        lv_total = lv_present + lv_absent + lv_leave.

        WRITE:/ sy-uline(130).

        WRITE: / 'Summary:'.
        WRITE: / 'Total Working Days:', lv_total.
        WRITE: / 'Total Present     :', lv_present.
        WRITE: / 'Total Absent      :', lv_absent.
        WRITE: / 'Total Leave       :', lv_leave.




      ELSEIF p_att5 = 'X'.

IF p_emid IS INITIAL.

          SELECT emid,
                 emname
               INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE @IT_attendance
               FROM zemploys.


        ELSEIF p_emid IS not INITIAL.

          SELECT emid,
                 emname
               INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE @IT_attendance
               FROM zemploys
             WHERE emid = @p_emid.

        ENDIF.

        LOOP AT it_attendance INTO wa_ATTENDANCE.

          WRITE: / 'Employee ID:',wa_ATTENDANCE-emid,
                   'Name:', wa_ATTENDANCE-emname.
        ENDLOOP.

   ENDIF.
  ENDCASE.

entry.title: Re: Double authorization while creating a sales order
entry.content:
SAP’s standard order creation logic automatically triggers a new authorization request if the payment card data is present in the iDoc, the order type or payment terms require authorization, no flag or indicator tells SAP that authorization has already occurred externally. Since your website already performs the authorization, SAP doesn’t recognize it unless explicitly told to skip or reuse the existing authorization.

  • One option is to pass External Authorization Reference in iDoc and include the authorization reference number (from PSP) in the iDoc segment. Use segment E1EDK37 (this segment holds payment terms, payment method, and potentially authorization refs) or a custom Z-segment to pass this value. SAP can then reuse the authorization instead of triggering a new one. Of course, this requires an enhancement in the order creation via USEREXIT_PAYMENT_CARD_PROCESSING, to check for existing authorization and bypass the standard call.
  • The other option is to explore BAdI BADI_SD_CREDIT_CARD or BADI_PAYM_AUTHORIZATION where you can implement a logic to suppress authorization if the iDoc contains a valid external reference.

entry.title: Re: Notification after removing credit block FSCM
entry.content: SAP FSCM supports Situation Handling, which can be configured to send notifications when certain thresholds or warnings are triggered. You can explore Manage Situation Types (F2947) to define a situation like “Credit Limit Warning.”, Copy and customize templates such as FIN_CLR_APPROVAL, Set conditions to trigger alerts when a customer’s credit exposure exceeds the limit and notify relevant users (e.g., credit analysts or sales reps) via Fiori notifications. Have a look at this blog by @darrelzaulda  so that you will come to know how to configure this using Manage Credit Management Rules and Situation Handling.

entry.title: Re: Shelf Life/Expiration date in SAP IBP for External Pr...
entry.content:
Yes, business function SCM_GEN_02 plays a key role in enabling shelf life data transfer between SAP ERP and SAP SCM. Without SCM_GEN_02, the system may default to using the delivery date as the expiration date, which is exactly what you're seeing.


What you can do is activate SCM_GEN_02 in your ERP system. Ensure material master data includes

  • total shelf life
  • Minimum remaining shelf life
  • Date of manufacture (if applicable)

Confirm that IBP integration models are configured to pull shelf life data correctly. Use FEFO logic in IBP to prioritize batches with earliest expiration dates.

entry.title: Re: Fiori Elements Excel Export with Header and Footer
entry.content:
Hi Ben,

Fiori Elements standard Excel export does not support headers/footers like what you saw ALV does by default.

How about below approach?
override the default export behavior using a custom button in your Fiori Elements app (via custom action or extension point) and implement logic like below:-
(let us use the master in downloadable Excel Reports: SheetJS)
-download minified version from "https://github.com/SheetJS/sheetjs"
-Place it in your SAPUI5 project under webapp/lib/xlsx/
-include in Component.js using below snippet:-
 

// Load SheetJS dynamically
  const loadSheetJS = function () {
    const sScriptPath = jQuery.sap.getModulePath("your.namespace") + "/lib/xlsx/xlsx.full.min.js";
    jQuery.sap.includeScript(sScriptPath);
  };

then for your custom action button event Ben,

onExportCustomExcel: function () {
  const oTable = this.byId("yourTableId");
  const aData = oTable.getBinding("items").getContexts().map(ctx => ctx.getObject());

  const header = [["Company Code: 1234"], ["Report Title: Stock Overview"], []];
  const footer = [[""], ["Printed On: 31.07.2025", "Printed By: Arun", "Page: 1"]];

  const wsData = [...header, ...aData.map(obj => [obj.Field1, obj.Field2, ...]), ...footer];

  const ws = XLSX.utils.aoa_to_sheet(wsData);
  const wb = XLSX.utils.book_new();
  XLSX.utils.book_append_sheet(wb, ws, "Report");
  XLSX.writeFile(wb, "Report.xlsx");
}

entry.title: System metrics when CALM is integrated with FRUN
entry.content:
Hi,

We are configuring to use CALM as a proxy to FRUN but it is not working as expected, 

I've noticed that systems now send metrics to FRUN and they are no longer in CALM.

Was hoping they could operate side by side - that is CALM for business users access and email alerting, but FRUN for technical users and ticket creation but seems I can only use one or the other.

Has anyone had experience with how the integration works between CALM and FRUN - can both be used at the same time ?


Thanks
Anita

entry.title: Re: SAP BAS Fiori html issue.
entry.content:
Hi,

It looks like you've tried to preview the code you've written so far, but the goal here is to create a working SAPUI5/Fiori application. This requires a specific folder structure—typically, all web development components (such as your index.html file) should reside within the webapp folder. The preview functionality is generally available when you right-click the webapp folder in your project.

You might find the following tutorial helpful to get started. For a basic setup, you can select "None" as the data source to begin with an empty template.

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 亮点前瞻：人工智能Artificial Intelligence
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud公共版2508版本新增了多项AI功能，通过自动化、智能分析和自然语言处理，显著提高企业的运营效率。这些更新重点聚焦在提升用户体验、实现流程自动化、获取深度业务洞察，以及优化现有功能上，旨在提高工作效率和准确性。

提示:

  • 使用SAP S/4HANA Cloud公共版中的部分生成式AI功能可能需要额外的授权和权限。有关AI功能使用的商务问题，请您咨询你的SAP客户经理。
  • 以下AI功能尚未在中国大陆地区上线，建议您咨询您的SAP客户经理以获取最新的信息。

以下是SAP S/4HANA Cloud公共版 2508版本中新增的一些主要AI功能及其介绍：

用户体验中的AI 创新：

AI辅助企业搜索 (AI-Assisted Enterprise Search)​​

  • ​​功能​​：用户现可直接在SAP Fiori Launchpad搜索栏中使用自然语言搜索业务对象。搜索结果基于AI生成的筛选条件生成，您可随时通过 ​​“AI解释”按钮​​查看筛选条件的逻辑。启用此功能需在用户档案设置中勾选 ​​“启用AI自然语言搜索”​​。
  • ​​效率提升​​：该功能使业务数据查找过程更直观高效，显著优于传统关键词搜索或复杂筛选设置，大幅提升信息获取效率。

点击图片查看视频

同时，近期推出的三项AI辅助用户体验创新功能—企业搜索(enterprise search)​​、​​轻松过滤器(easy filter)​​ 和​​智能总结(smart summarization)​​—现已在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中免费使用。您只需接受 ​​SAP AI使用条款​​，SAP将会为您的租户启用这些功能，即刻体验更直观的交互操作、更快的洞察速度及更高的生产效率。

更多的AI辅助功能介绍（如轻松过滤器、智能总结），请参考往期博客 。

Joule for Business

虽然 SAP Joule 的发布周期与 SAP S/4HANA Cloud 公共版有所不同，但在2025年在以下的三个领域实现了突破性的增强。

  1. ​​实时业务对象洞察​​
    • 直接通过自然语言指令查看​​34类业务对象​​详情，覆盖采购/销售/生产订单等核心模块（如显示逾期采购订单项）
  2. ​​跨模块事务处理​​
    • ​​财务领域​​：对话式创建固定资产（输入：公司代码+资产类别+成本中心）
    • ​​销售领域​​：
      ✓ 动态管理到期价格（延长有效期并调整金额）
      ✓ 实时诊断销售订单阻塞问题（如信用冻结/数据缺失）
    • ​​一键生成洞察卡​​：将查询结果保存至"我的主页"（支持采购/销售订单等应用）

详细内容，请移步Joule功能全景介绍：Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition... - SAP Community。

财务中的AI创新

财务业务洞察的快捷操作(Business Insights Quick Actions)

集团财务报表审阅手册 (Group Financial Statements Review Booklet)

    • 经过2502版本的beta测试后，集团财务报表审阅手册中预定义的AI辅助业务洞察功能——即快捷操作（Quick Action）——现已在最近版本中全面上线。用户可通过该功能快速生成数据分析和摘要。这些智能分析包括损益（按费用性质）、底线增长、EBIT、EBITDA、财务结果、营业收入/亏损、盈利能力、顶线增长和货币差异等。

这些洞察通过以自然语言分析突出关键数字、差异和相关背景，帮助简化财务审阅流程。    

目前您还可以在财务洞察审阅手册中使用以下预定义的AI辅助业务洞察功能：成本中心审阅手册 (Cost Centers Review Booklet)

此功能在2502发布，可以帮助您发现成本中心审查手册中的数据意义、突出数据之间的依赖关系，利用自然语言快速解释和汇总洞察，并建议相应的操作。详情请见往期博客

AI辅助解释固定资产关键指标 (AI-assisted explanation of fixed asset key figures)

    • 功能: 本功能基于SAP Business AI深度解析固定资产关键指标的计算逻辑，通过自然语言以通俗易懂的方式，向用户解释系统计算固定资产价值的过程。详细解释固定资产关键指标（如折旧和账面净值）的计算来源和构成。例如，它能详细说明在年中购置后，使用特定折旧码时，折旧值是如何计算的。

    • 效率提升: 这项功能能够显著减少理解固定资产计算所需的时间，帮助用户更好地理解复杂的资产估值细节，并确定为何会发生意外的价值变化（例如，意外过账的特殊折旧）。通过更轻松地理解资产和折旧值，提高了业务用户的生产力。它简化了解释过程，让用户能更快地掌握财务数据和价值变化，从而提升效率并支持更好的决策制定。

生成式AI创建固定资产主数据 (Generative AI capability: creating fixed asset master data)

    • 功能: 用户可通过与Joule对话，直接创建固定资产主数据（如创建笔记本电脑资产）, 从而减少错误并确保更高的数据准确性和更好的数据治理。

    • 效率提升: 它能够减少创建资产主数据所需的时间和精力，相比通过复杂的传统SAP Fiori应用程序进行导航更为高效。同时，通过对话式数据输入流程，减少了错误并确保了更高的数据准确性和更好的数据治理。此外，还能减少大规模培训时间并加快最终用户入职，通过允许用户在对话中快速输入和管理数据来提高业务用户的工作效率和满意度。

风险管理中的AI创新

  1. AI辅助的贸易分类建议与模糊搜索 (AI-assisted trade classification proposals with fuzzy search)
    • 功能: 从SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508版本开始，系统将通过使用SAP HANA模糊搜索技术，根据现有产品分类的相似性搜索，为产品分配海关关税号和商品代码的贸易分类建议。系统会根据产品描述的比较生成匹配列表和估计准确度的分数。
    • 效率提升: 贸易分类可能复杂且耗时，此功能自动化并加速了这一过程，通过根据已有的贸易产品分类提供准确的分类建议，减少了手动工作量和潜在错误。提高了贸易分类专家的生产力。

质量管理中的AI创新

SAP Document AI辅助处理入库质量证书 (AI-Assisted Processing of Incoming Quality Certificates with SAP Document AI)

    • 功能: 此功能能够自动处理入库质量证书文件。SAP Document AI提取质量证书数据，并尽可能自动将证书附加到相关的证书收据，或者在没有匹配收据的情况下创建新的收据。如果系统无法明确识别或更新收据，用户可以在新的“审查证书文档匹配”应用程序中查看提取的数据并手动完成匹配。这是一个全自动化的流程，显著减少了手动输入和人为错误。此功能无需定制开发，可立即为客户带来价值。
    • 效率提升: 通过自动化处理，它显著减少了手动输入和人为错误，从而更高效地处理证书，确保信息不丢失或被忽略。质量技术人员被解放出来，可以专注于更具战略性和增值性的活动。这也能实现更快的库存发布，减少与检查相关的生产延误，并全面提高吞吐量。

可扩展性AI助手 (Extensibility AI Assistant)

    • 功能: 这是一个由生成式AI驱动的助手。在“自定义字段”应用程序中，它能帮助您完成与字段可扩展性相关的各种任务，例如创建自定义字段、查找业务上下文、用法、值帮助视图和启用业务场景。在“自定义逻辑”应用程序中，该助手还可以根据您的自然语言输入来查找BAdI（业务附加项）。它通过智能的用法分析增强了透明度，支持更好的治理和更高效的变更管理。
    • 效率提升: 您只需用日常语言描述需求，AI就能自动查找和创建所需内容。这将极大地减少手动配置和探索的时间，让字段扩展和BAdI查找任务变得前所未有的快速和高效。它还能帮助自定义字段与底层业务流程保持一致，提高系统行为的一致性和相关性。

 

详细请参考博客

 管理本地化表单模板(Manage Localized Form Templates)

此功能在2502版本中发布, 您可以在此应用程序中，通过自然语言描述来对SAP发布的本地化表单模板进行扩展。在2508版本中，在“管理本地化表单模板”应用的表单生成屏幕中添加了提示词（prompt）历史记录部分。您可以通过查看提示历史记录中的提示词来检查对表单模板扩展执行过哪些操作。

以上这篇文章希望可以帮助您更好地理解SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中AI创新功能及其在2508版本的最新发布资讯。

有关 SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 版本交付内容的更多详细信息，请参阅

Watch the replays of our exclusive SAP S/4HANA Clo... - SAP Community 

感谢阅读。

entry.title: Re: How to Integrate E-Invoice India in sap public cloud...
entry.content:
Providing step by step configuration is definitely a challenge for anybody. You need to start from somewhere based on the blog.

The integrations steps are clearly mentioned in the blog. In fact, under the heading Implementation steps, it is clearly mentioned what should be activated, which is 'Scope Item 5XU – SAP Document and Reporting Compliance'. Ensure, your third-party provider supports integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud (e.g., via PEPPOL, GSTN, PAC, etc.). Have access to SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) and SAP Integration Suite.

Then comes to Architecture setup, it is also mentioned in the blog clearly that you need to set up middleware (SAP BTP or third-party) to act as a bridge between SAP and tax authorities. Deploy Integration Flows (iFlows) in SAP Integration Suite for your country-specific e-invoicing scenario and activate Communication Arrangements in SAP S/4HANA Cloud to enable data exchange.

Activate Document and Reporting Compliance Features via CBC or Solution Builder. Use the app Manage Your Solution to access configuration activities.

If you go through the header Maintaining value mappings, in the blog, it is stated that you need to use the Configure Value Mapping app to map internal SAP values to external codes required by the tax authority or third-party provider. The related examples are also given. 

Also in the blog, SAP's Help documentations are shared where couple of SAP notes are referred.  Go through all those SAP notes.

With all the above information, you and your team have to start from scratch, no doubt, you will face en-number of issues. Post here with the related screen shot, so that the members will assist you
